'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Toronto, Ontario, Canada', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'University of Toronto', 'description': '-Undergraduate Thesis Research Position
-Project: Testing the chemical homogeneity of chemically-tagged dissolved birth clusters (submitted to MNRAS, Oct. 2020)
-Supervisors: Professor Jo Bovy (Associate Professor and Canada Research Chair in Galactic Astrophysics) and Dr. Natalie Price-Jones (PhD 2020), Department of Astronomy and Astrophysics/Dunlap Institute for Astronomy and Astrophysics, University of Toronto
-Analyzing data from APOGEE DR14 (using the apogee Python package) to test the chemical homogeneity of chemically-tagged dissolved birth clusters, whereby we constrain the intrinsic abundance scatter in star clusters using stellar spectra instead of derived abundances, reducing the uncertainty in the abundance scatter significantly.
-Modeling stellar spectra as a one-dimensional function of initial stellar mass, performing forward modeling on the observed stellar spectra, and comparing the simulated and observed spectra using Approximate Bayesian Computation to determine tight constraints on the intrinsic abundance scatter.
-Refining problem solving skills and ability to ask focused questions during meetings with advisors.
-Presenting results in scientific presentations and reports.', 'title': 'Student Researcher', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 26327, 'name': 'TRIUMF', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQHsm0f4s4rDQw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519856629296?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=VFHjCwtH4ho-avzKp29BqPGnafvPE2U56PMerBEFnPo', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/triumf/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'company': 'TRIUMF', 'description': '-Supervisor: Dr. Adam B. Garnsworthy, GRIFFIN Chair and Collaboration Spokesperson
-Learned how to use C++, ROOT, and GRSISort to perform electron and gamma-ray spectroscopy on data from an experiment on 192Hg.
-Assisted in developing an updated level scheme using SciDraw in Mathematica; calculated internal conversion coefficients and mixing ratios.
-Results: firmly established spin-parity assignments for the negative-parity band; measured the mixing ratio for the 8- -> 7- transition and firmly established the spin-parity of the 8- state.
-Performed hands-on work: assisted in reconfiguring the GRIFFIN and TIGRESS detectors and recabling the data acquisition systems.
-Worked shifts during experimental beam run time, in a high-pressure, high-risk environment: calibrated equipment, monitored the experiment, communicated with beam operations staff.', 'title': 'Research Assistant', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}, {'company': {'id': 11737331, 'name': 'Krembil Research Institute', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFoBj7Nfsu2-w/company-logo_400_400/0/1528305048766?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=9JvJ_C4AR5ph_8UCzsut7tlwdHAhhMF72xwu5Hz1jCY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/krembil-research-institute/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Toronto, Ontario, Canada', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'Krembil Research Institute', 'description': "-Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council Undergraduate Student Research Award/Institute of Medical Science Student
-Supervisor: Dr. Liang Zhang, Department of Fundamental Neurobiology
-Taught undergraduate students, senior Research Fellows, and Faculty members about lab techniques, including mouse handling, kindling, brain sectioning, slide preparation, and slide staining.
-Collaborated with 4 other Faculty members' lab groups and helped them to complete experiments.
-Took on a Leadership Role -- organized, supervised, and managed 6 undergraduate students and 2 International Research Fellows for the lab activities outlined above.
-Assisted in verifying the mouse model for MRI-negative temporal-lobe epilepsy, developed below. 
-Research Volunteer responsibilities (detailed below).", 'title': 'Undergraduate Research Assistant', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}, {'company': {'id': 11737331, 'name': 'Krembil Research Institute', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFoBj7Nfsu2-w/company-logo_400_400/0/1528305048766?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=9JvJ_C4AR5ph_8UCzsut7tlwdHAhhMF72xwu5Hz1jCY', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/krembil-research-institute/', 'employees': {'start': 201, 'end': 500}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Toronto, Ontario, Canada', 'date': {'start': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Krembil Research Institute', 'description': '-Part of a team of students who performed experiments involving kindling seizures in mice; handled mice, participated in stimulation and drug injection procedures, and made EEG recordings during experiments.
-Sectioned brain tissue and prepared and stained slides; performed cell counting on tissue sections to find significant differences in cell numbers between kindled and unkindled mice.
-Soldered wires and electrodes to be used in mouse experiments.
-Used MATLAB to analyze EEG recordings of seizures in mice and for general data analysis.
-Assisted in developing a mouse model for MRI-negative temporal-lobe epilepsy.', 'title': 'Volunteer Research Assistant', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}]
